articles.author: SAMY MAGDY
articles.description: MOUNT ARAFAT, Saudi Arabia (AP) — Following the footsteps of prophets beneath a burning sun, Muslims from around the world congregated Saturday at a sacred hill in Saudi Arabia for intense, daylong worship and reflection.
articles.title: Muslim pilgrims converge at Mount Arafat for daylong worship as Hajj reaches its peak

articles.author: FATMA KHALED and WAFAA SHURAFA
articles.description: DEIR AL-BALAH, Gaza Strip (AP) — Last summer, Palestinians in the Gaza Strip celebrated the Muslim holiday of Eid al-Adha the way it's supposed to be: with large family feasts, meat shared with those less fortunate, and new clothes and gifts for children.
articles.title: A usually joyous Muslim holiday reminds families in Gaza of war's punishing toll

articles.author: JON GAMBRELL
articles.description: DUBAI, United Arab Emirates (AP) — The United States military unleashed a wave of attacks targeting radar sites operated by Yemen's Houthi rebels over their assaults on shipping in the crucial Red Sea corridor, authorities said Saturday, after one merchant sailor went missing following an earlier Houthi strike on a ship.
articles.title: US military targets Houthi radar sites in Yemen after a merchant sailor goes missing

articles.author: DARLENE SUPERVILLE and WILL WEISSERT
articles.description: WASHINGTON (AP) — Flying through the night across nine time zones, from southern Italy to Southern California, President Joe Biden will shift focus from Russia's challenge of Western unity to raking in big bucks for his reelection campaign at a Hollywood fundraiser featuring George Clooney and Julia Roberts.
articles.title: Biden goes straight from G7 to Hollywood fundraiser, balancing geopolitics with his reelection bid

articles.author: ALANNA DURKIN RICHER and FARNOUSH AMIRI
articles.description: WASHINGTON (AP) — Speaker Mike Johnson said Friday that the House will go to court to enforce the subpoena against Attorney General Merrick Garland for access to President Joe Biden's special counsel audio interview, hours after the Justice Department refused to prosecute Republicans’ contempt of Congress charge.
articles.title: Speaker Johnson says House will go to court for Biden audio after Justice Dept. refused to prosecute

articles.author: MARY CLARE JALONICK
articles.description: WASHINGTON (AP) — Three years ago, Donald Trump had few friends left in the Senate.Senate Republican Leader Mitch McConnell declared in a speech that Trump was “practically and morally responsible” for the violent Jan.
articles.title: Many Senate Republicans were done with Trump after Jan. 6. Now they want him back in the White House

articles.author: SAMYA KULLAB
articles.description: KYIV, Ukraine (AP) — Ukrainian firepower has been improving since U.S. lawmakers approved a much-needed military aid package this spring, though not quickly enough to halt the Russian offensive in eastern Ukraine.
articles.title: Ukraine employs a flexible defense while waiting for new Western ammo to get to the front

articles.author: DAVE COLLINS, JUAN A. LOZANO and JIM VERTUNO
articles.description: HOUSTON (AP) — Bombastic conspiracy theorist Alex Jones has been ordered to liquidate his personal assets as he owes $1.5 billion for his false claims that the 2012 Sandy Hook Elementary School shooting, which killed 20 first graders and six educators in Newtown, Connecticut, was a hoax.
articles.title: What we know about the fight between conspiracist Alex Jones and Sandy Hook families over his assets

articles.author: TIM REYNOLDS
articles.description: DALLAS (AP) — There were two options for the Dallas Mavericks. Pack for Boston, or pack for vacation.Boston awaits.These NBA Finals are not over, thanks to one of the biggest blowouts in title-round history.
articles.title: Doncic scores 29, Mavericks roll past the Celtics 122-84 to avoid a sweep in the NBA Finals

articles.author: The Associated Press
articles.description: Charles Barkley said Friday that next season will be his last on TV, no matter what happens with the NBA's media deals.The Hall of Fame player has spent the last 24 years working as a studio analyst for TNT, which could lose the rights to broadcast NBA after next season.
articles.title: Charles Barkley says next season will be his last on TV, no matter what happens with NBA media deals
